1.text: Then the LORD said to Moses,

2.text: “Command the Israelites and say to them: See that you present to Me at its appointed time the food for My food offerings, as a pleasing aroma to Me.

3.text: And tell them that this is the food offering you are to present to the LORD as a regular burnt offering each day: two unblemished year-old male lambs.

4.text: Offer one lamb in the morning and the other at twilight,

5.text: along with a tenth of an ephah of fine flour as a grain offering, mixed with a quarter hin of oil from pressed olives.

6.text: This is a regular burnt offering established at Mount Sinai as a pleasing aroma, a food offering to the LORD.

7.text: The drink offering accompanying each lamb shall be a quarter hin. Pour out the offering of fermented drink to the LORD in the sanctuary area.

8.text: And offer the second lamb at twilight, with the same grain offering and drink offering as in the morning. It is a food offering, a pleasing aroma to the LORD.

9.text: On the Sabbath day, present two unblemished year-old male lambs, accompanied by a grain offering of two-tenths of an ephah of fine flour mixed with oil, as well as a drink offering.

10.text: This is the burnt offering for every Sabbath, in addition to the regular burnt offering and its drink offering.

11.text: At the beginning of every month, you are to present to the LORD a burnt offering of two young bulls, one ram, and seven male lambs a year old, all unblemished,

12.text: along with three-tenths of an ephah of fine flour mixed with oil as a grain offering with each bull, two-tenths of an ephah of fine flour mixed with oil as a grain offering with the ram,

13.text: and a tenth of an ephah of fine flour mixed with oil as a grain offering with each lamb. This is a burnt offering, a pleasing aroma, a food offering to the LORD.

14.text: Their drink offerings shall be half a hin of wine with each bull, a third of a hin with the ram, and a quarter hin with each lamb. This is the monthly burnt offering to be made at each new moon throughout the year.

15.text: In addition to the regular burnt offering with its drink offering, one male goat is to be presented to the LORD as a sin offering.

16.text: The fourteenth day of the first month is the LORD’s Passover.

17.text: On the fifteenth day of this month, there shall be a feast; for seven days unleavened bread is to be eaten.

18.text: On the first day there is to be a sacred assembly; you must not do any regular work.

19.text: Present to the LORD a food offering, a burnt offering of two young bulls, one ram, and seven male lambs a year old, all unblemished.

20.text: The grain offering shall consist of fine flour mixed with oil; offer three-tenths of an ephah with each bull, two-tenths of an ephah with the ram,

21.text: and a tenth of an ephah with each of the seven lambs.

22.text: Include one male goat as a sin offering to make atonement for you.

23.text: You are to present these in addition to the regular morning burnt offering.

24.text: Offer the same food each day for seven days as a food offering, a pleasing aroma to the LORD. It is to be offered with its drink offering and the regular burnt offering.

25.text: On the seventh day you shall hold a sacred assembly; you must not do any regular work.

26.text: On the day of firstfruits, when you present an offering of new grain to the LORD during the Feast of Weeks, you are to hold a sacred assembly; you must not do any regular work.

27.text: Present a burnt offering of two young bulls, one ram, and seven male lambs a year old as a pleasing aroma to the LORD,

28.text: together with their grain offerings of fine flour mixed with oil—three-tenths of an ephah with each bull, two-tenths of an ephah with the ram,

29.text: and a tenth of an ephah with each of the seven lambs.

30.text: Include one male goat to make atonement for you.

31.text: Offer them with their drink offerings in addition to the regular burnt offering and its grain offering. The animals must be unblemished.
